alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 02 at 9:29AM AKST until January 03 at 5:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 AM AKST WEDNESDAY FOR INTERIOR BRISTOL BAY... * WHAT...East winds 30 to 45 mph with gusts of 55 to 70 mph expected. * WHERE...Interior Bristol Bay, including Iliamna, Koliganek, and New Stuyahok. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 5 AM AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...High winds may move loose debris, damage property, and cause power outages. Travel will be difficult. Gusty winds may cause blowing and drifting of snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds over interior Bristol Bay will peak late this evening into the overnight hours. Although not quite as strong, gusts of 50 to 60 mph are also expected along the Alaska Peninsula south of King Salmon, including Port Heiden, Pilot Point, and Egegik. For King Salmon and Naknek over to the Dillingham area, winds will be a bit weaker, with gusts of 35 to 45 mph. Temperatures will remain above freezing across the region, with precipitation falling as mostly rain. There will be some snow at the start for inland areas, with low visibilities as the high winds blow the falling snow.
info.instruction: People are urged to secure loose objects that could be blown around or damaged by the wind. Prepare for the possibility of widespread power outages. Use caution if you must drive.
